titulo: Compl Bus Control Sr Analyst (Issue Management Officer)
descripcion:
The Transaction Svs Manager is an intermediate management level position responsible for leading and supervising a medium sized unit of support employees, in coordination with the Transaction Capture team. The overall objective of this role is to improve processes, interpret data, prepare reports, and minimize bank risk through ensuring adherence to audit and control policies.



Responsibilities:
Manage the mandatory CFTC Initial Margin Segregation control process to ensure Citi is compliant
Manage and lead multiple strategic departments, industry and regulatory initiatives and projects relating to OTC Margin
Oversee the intercompany margining process to support mandatory exchange of variation margin between Citi affiliates
Provide collateral query support to Business, Credit, Treasury and Legal teams, to reduce risk exposure for the firm
Oversee remote teams that support interest processing
Review and approve large value collateral movements and ensure accuracy of entries and participate in internal/external audit reviews
Approve the release of collateral, monitor collateral balance breaks and fails and track movements in mark to market on open positions
Ensure the team is properly trained and team members are settling interest in a timely manner
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency, as well as effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards.
Qualifications:
5-8 years of experience in a related role
Demonstrated project management skills
Ability to work under pressure and manage to deadlines
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication
Attention to detail and intermediate problem solving skills
Education:
Bachelor’s degree/University degree or equivalent experience
Drive closure of issues using project management methodology.
Develops a project plan per issue, ensuring milestone activities are captured for every CAP, a critical path to resolve the issue is outlined, and a responsible to execute each task in the plan is identified.
Tracks on issue performance using project management methodology, ensuring issues with technological dependencies are funded and prioritized in Technology’s book of work.
Promptly escalates delays and deviations to critical path baseline.
Manages administrative tasks to ensure proper issue documentation and maintenance in GRC, including impact mapping in MCA.
Understanding and use of Project Management Methodology and tools.
Capacity to develop a presentation (ppt) to senior audience.
Negotiation and influence prefer talent for the problem.
Educación:
Entendimiento del idioma ingles: Leer (80%) / Escribir (80%) / Hablar (80%)
Preferente: Conocimiento y/experiencia en productos de pagos y Cobranza

Contribute to Quarterly Competitor Reviews, Quarterly Annotated Supplement, and Quarterly Investment Reports

titulo: GBS People Services- IAM Operations Analyst (Level 6)
descripcion:
About GM
There’s never been a more exciting time to work for General Motors.




To achieve our vision of a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion, we need people to join us who are passionate about creating safer, better and more sustainable ways for people to get around. This bold vision won’t happen overnight, but just as we transformed how the world moved in the last century, we are committed to transforming how we move today and in the future.
Why Work for Us
Our culture is focused on building inclusive teams, where differences and unique perspectives are embraced so you can contribute to your fullest potential as you pursue your career. Our locations feature a variety of work environments, including open work spaces and virtual connection platforms to inspire productivity and flexible collaboration. And we are proud to support our employees volunteer interests, and make it a priority to join together in efforts that give back to our communities.
Job Description
You will lead aspects of transformation and operations, at the business unit level and globally. You work largely within existing partnerships and networks to deliver pre-defined business objectives, while formally managing a team. Your role may also require working within an influence model.
Additional Job Description
Frequent contact with others outside the work group - Including end-users
Engage with customers in a professional and courteous manner
Diagnose identity application problems to establish root cause and drive to resolve customer issues
Utilize all data systems and knowledge bases for resolution of problems, including 3rd Party Vendors, IT Support, Business Owners, Data Quality, etc.
Complete all backend paperwork and issue logging in a timely manner
Work involves accuracy and ability to make decisions within the limits of general policies and procedures. Significant independent judgment is used
Report any unresolved issues to leadership for further escalation/resolution
GBS IAM Identity Lifecycle Operations Critical Skillsets:
Excellent problem solving skills
High level analytical ability where problems are unusual and complex
Ability to manage numerous tasks simultaneously and follow through to completion
Ability to work at a detailed level while maintaining an overall perspective
Customer Focused and detail oriented
Good organizational and time management skills
Effective written and verbal English communication skills
Proficient in Microsoft Office products, Excel, Word, Outlook, OneNote, SharePoint
Required Qualifications:
Demonstrated technical and professional skills in job-related areas
Ability to manage numerous tasks simultaneously
Bachelor’s degree in technology, engineering, human resources or related discipline or equivalent experience
Call Center work experience
Preferred Qualifications:
Demonstrated technical and professional skills in identity and access management (IAM) systems and related areas
Demonstrates initiative by reaching beyond work assigned to improve output and/or help others
Proven ability in project management skills and ability to teach others
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple and significantly complex tasks and assignments with high level of autonomy and accountability for results
Exceptional interpersonal/team building skills including the ability to communicate with all levels of the organization, outside suppliers, and participate on multi-functional teams
Excellent at building relationships with team members and customers to solve problems and resolve issues
Experience on data analysis & quality customer experience
Diversity Information
General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities.
We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

CI Specialist


What will you do?


The CI Specialist for the HRSSC is responsible for identifying key process improvement opportunities and supporting the transformation of high quality, process execution throughout the HRSSC organization. This role provides support to functional areas to instill a Continuous Improvement culture throughout the HRSSC by educating in CI tools, Lean Manufacturing and Six Sigma methodologies. This role works closely with functional areas to implement and deliver improvements in process performance and is responsible of managing the Innovation program for the HRSSC. In addition, this role is responsible to administer the new service in-take process by coordinating HRSSC functional areas and serving as a liaison with customers from the analysis and acceptance to the transition of the new service into HRSSC’s operation. Support HRSSC teams in the identification of automation opportunities and supervises the work of the Automation analyst.


How will you do it?
Identifies key process improvement opportunities and supports the transformation of high quality, process execution throughout the HRSSC organization.
Identifies and leads implementation of improved processes, services, through projects according to business needs.
Works with functional area leaders to drive overall improvements for the front end and back office operations.
Act as a change agent to improve existing processes. Can engage in driving local programs on various efforts aligned to culture and engagement.
Develop and implement processes to facilitate organization changes and support with appropriate change management processes
Provides reports to HRSSC Leadership on project status and key deliverables.
Trains HRSSC members on Continuous Improvement, Six Sigma and Lean Manufacturing tools and methodology.
Innovation program coordination (reports, guides and documents)
Coordinates transition of services from HR Solutions or CoEs to HRSSC service portfolio
Supports automation initiatives and supervises role dedicated to simple automations in preparation for RPA initiatives
Training of yellow and green belt to HRSSC.

People & HR Activities


Manages the day to day operations and inquiries of the direct report. Ensure all hiring, performance reviews and performance management issues are addressed, in accordance with HR practices and procedures.
Manages the workforce planning needs and career development for team members.
Manages actively team members’ work volume and investigates inefficiencies.
Builds a climate that energizes team members, fosters employee engagement and drives accountability.
Assists with recruitment, hiring and retaining HRSSC staff.
Develops and implement improvement plans for those employees who are not performing up to the expectations and administer discipline actions when appropriate.



What we look for?
Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, IT, Administration or related field required.
5 years of managerial experience in Continuous Improvement roles required, experience within HR Service Center desired.
Previous experience leading Continuous Improvement/Lean Initiatives is required. Green Belt Certification required.
Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong process orientation; demonstrated experience in planning and execution
Advanced Excel skills. (Dynamic tables, macros, etc.)
High Analytical and Problem-Solving skills.
Able to handle large amount of data in excel or other data base program.
High English Proficiency (written and spoken), capable of delivering presentations in English.
Oral and written communication skills.
Ability to understand and develop successfully partnerships with customers and peers.
Detail oriented.
High Customer Service orientation


Professional knowledge:
 Advance knowledge of basic CI Skills, 5S, Kaizen and other CI related training
Green Belt certification required.
Related experience in transactional processes.
Experience implementing Process automation (Robotic system)
Training others in CI methodologies

The Actuarial Analyst will assists with statistical and actuarial analysis projects through maintaining, building, and delivering reports in a timely fashion to meet internal client needs. Provides technical assistance in the areas of automation, actuarial analysis and acts as a strategic problem solver by developing programs, spreadsheets and databases to organize and analyze data. As a minu employee, you can do the work you love, be yourself, and make an impact in the lives of millions. Our commitments to diversity and inclusion, team culture and the spaces where we work all reflect our mission to keep access to earned wages human.

Do you believe that phenomenal writing can transform a customer's experience and how they feel about a product and a brand? Do you know how to explain complex concepts in a clear, conversational, and engaging way—and when to add dashes of magic? minu is seeking a product copywriter who's skilled in UX language and design and loves ideas and strategy as much as writing, testing, and iterating. A great candidate will be able to think conceptually and strategically about copy for web and mobile interfaces, and help bring those ideas to life through words. If this sounds like you, we want you on our team!

About the UX Product team

We are minu's voice, working closely with our partner teams to bring the brand to life throughout our marketing channels and product experiences. Our writing is not only informative, encouraging, and persuasive, but captures the imagination and fun of minu's brand—and the human side of access to earned wages. We're passionate about minu's mission to keep improve the financial wellbeing for the lives of millions of Mexican employees, and that passion drives everything we do.

About the position

The UX Copywriter will play a key role in the product discovery and development process, working hand-in-hand with our design, product, research, and analytics teams to build and execute effective content plans. In addition to supporting new products across our company and employee experiences, you'll assist with site and app audits and incremental improvements to existing products. If you join us, here are some of the other things you'll do:
Work closely with data analysts and researchers to conduct qualitative and quantitative research, including user research and A/B testing, to create copy human, encouraging, and forward-thinking copy that drives product adoption and builds brand loyalty.
Plan, write, edit, test, and improve UX copy, including interface language, product names, and navigational nomenclature, in addition to in-product education and marketing messaging.
Think through projects strategically and creatively, from idea through production, working cross-functionally with partners in research, data analytics, marketing, design, product, and engineering.
Help strategize, implement, and maintain a consistent content strategy throughout the product experience, deeply understanding how customers interact with minu, using data to inform decisions, and building alignment between UX and marketing content.
Craft wireframes, mockups, and task flows to effectively communicate UX content ideas.

You're a skilled communicator and collaborator.Additional Information

A great opportunity to grow and work with the most amazing people in the industry.

Objective:

Drive the architectural design, implementation plan, best practices, and testing plans for projects involving terabytes of data, which will serve as the foundation of advanced analytics and machine learning initiatives.

Goal of our team:

Transport data reliably across all our systems and users for analytical purposes.

Requirements of the position:

Strong programming skills with solid engineering foundations: coding practices, architectural and design skills.
Experience designing and implementing ETL processes, dealing with big volumes of data requiring distributed processing
Experience with NoSQL databases such as Apache HBase, MongoDB, Cassandra, etc.
Experience in data stream processing technologies including Kafka, Spark Streaming, etc.
Experience working with infrastructure as a code (AWS Cloudformation, Ansible, etc.)
Experience with RESTful API oriented design and service-oriented architectures

What you will be doing:

Build services which allow us to ingest and transform data among many layers of our architecture. No matter the size, format and speed we can tackle it.
Keep on learning the newest data processing technologies such as NoSQL, Orchestrators, Serverless, Autoscaling Clusters and many others.

Work closely with other Engineers, Data Scientists, Product Owners and Managers, Analysts and nontechnical stakeholders to help them get access to reliable data

What you won’t be doing:

Using common ETL tools like Informatica, Talend, Pentaho, etc. We build our own systems.
Building, Deploying or maintaining Machine Learning Models or complex Feature Engineering. These tasks are handled by our Data Science and Machine Learning Engineer Teams.
Building and maintaining relational databases. We don’t handle transactional processing.
Directly managing people. While we work as a team you won’t have people reporting directly to you

You will need to be successful:

You have intellectual curiosity and the capacity to learn and implement new data architectures and leading edge technologies.
You thrive in dynamic, fast-paced, results-oriented teams
You believe in building great products and doing great work
You want to understand the big picture, to be held accountable and make a meaningful contribution with your work

Python, Java or Scala proficiency
Solid experience with Spark
+3 years of experience with large-scale data engineering
Experience with cloud platforms & services
English: intermediate-advanced
Unit / functional / integration testing

Plus:

BS/MS/Ph.D. in Computer Science or equivalent
Statistical analysis and descriptive analytics

Position Summary
The Demand Planner position is a key role responsible for generating and managing the global demand signal used by downstream supply chain processes to prepare for actual customer demand. The current application is SAP SCM (APO Demand Planning module). Along with managing all facets of the monthly forecasting cycle for assigned products, the Demand Planner will provide leadership for driving continuous process improvement and best practice initiatives and will contribute data and decision support analytics to various functions. This position reports through the Demand Planning Center of Excellence in the Materials organization but is viewed as an integral part of the respective Business Unit(s) supported.

Major Responsibilities Manage quantitative forecast elements by analyzing product demand patterns, trends, and seasonality to select the optimal statistical models and parameters.
 Manage qualitative forecast elements by driving cross-functional collaboration to obtain relevant data and insights on demand. Contribute to new product planning initial forecast estimates; monitor the market response. Manage discontinued items; partner cross functionally to ensure a smooth, cost effective, phase-out.
 Monitor performance indicators and perform post period analysis to determine and communicate key drivers of error and opportunities for improvement.
 Lead demand planning consensus efforts; confer with management on forecasting assumptions, analysis, and decisions.
 Prepare and maintain relevant reports pertaining to demand planning process. Provide data and decision support analyses to key stakeholders.
 Work with peers and cross functional resources to develop and implement solutions to drive continuous improvement and improve business decisions related to demand planning. Provide demand related input to supply counterparts to assist with decisions on strategies deployed, inventory levels, and stocking considerations.
Participate as the demand expert for assigned products for cross functional company initiatives.
Qualifications
Education, Desired Skills and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Business Administration with a Supply Chain or Operations Management focus; other majors will be considered.

Minimum 5 years’ experience in supply chain related roles with 2-3 years of demand planning and / or reporting analyst experience preferred.
Demonstrated proficiency in forecasting methods with an understanding of the financial and operational impacts.

Ability to effectively break down complex data (quantitative and qualitative) into manageable pieces to be used in the forecasting process.

Ability to work and influence effectively cross functionally and across multiple levels of management.

Possess the business acumen and interpersonal skills to build and maintain relationships across departments.

Ability to propose new ideas and approaches and bring creative ideas to fruition.
Conflict management.

Working knowledge of SAP, APO, MS Excel.

Introduction

Do you want to help us transform the way IBM manages Incentives for all its Sellers?

As an Agile delivery organization, our mission is to deliver best-in-class systems and tools that differentiate us from our competitors and help our Sales incentives partners and Sellers with tools to drive sustained revenue growth by enabling the Sales plan & Go-to-market strategy.

Our team incorporates Design Thinking and cutting edge technologies and practices to design and build signature experiences that make IBM Sales Force’s lives easier.


Our systems are built on logical modular blocks integrated into a single architecture and tool suite and we deliver:

+1 Billion Transactions processed every year from +100 sources, transformed into payroll and sent to sellers individually.100 Thousand Sales Plans successfully implemented twice a year.170 Terabytes of data.40 modules developed and supported.


Your Role and Responsibilities


Would you like to work in a fun and experimental atmosphere?

We are a diverse and empowered, co-located team of analysts, developers, automation engineers and managers located at IBM Guadalajara; an exciting collaborative space that promotes togetherness and community. We operate in an open and flat organization where everyone’s ideas are valued and we’re able to learn from each other.



Do you enjoy technical challenges, and meeting business and user needs with creative solutions?



Are you the kind of person who enjoys tackling complex problems and crafting their solutions?




Do you want to work for a world-class organization, utilizing the best modern technologies for the job?



We are looking for a high-calibre Application Architect to join our team, building applications and solving problems for IBM's Incentives

We have an exciting collaborative space which brings together best-in-class people, technology and workspaces to create leading software solutions. We take a group of automation engineers, developers, and business analysts, so that they work together to address the problem, in a "We give you a problem, you decide how to solve it" environment.

You will be responsible to lead and coach all development teams in the Incentives organization in Guadalajara, where they develop web applications & data intensive applications based on an Even-Driven Architecture delivered on IBM’s Cloud.

You’ll be identifying, proposing and using the latest tools and technologies available to deliver state-of-the-art software and web applications. You’ll have the opportunity to work with the latest technologies, ensuring the applications delivered are high performing, responsive and maintainable.

You’ll be responsible for ensuring that components are expertly designed, tested, debugged, verified, and ready for integration into various contexts across the IBM Enterprise, creating a productive environment for IBMers. You will be responsible for leading technical discussions and enabling all the different teams to deliver solutions that met all defined requirements.







Required Technical and Professional Expertise



Proven experience in an Object Oriented Programming Language of more than 10 yearsProven experience leading a team of developers for 5+ yearsProven experience of designing new solutions and/or defining new architectures to exceeds business needsFamiliarity with different Software Architecture TypesExperience with Data EngineeringExperience with Event-Driven ArchitecturesExperience delivering web applications using JavaScript frameworks such as AngularJS/Angular, React, Vue.jsFamiliarity with Test Driven and Behaviour Driven Development practices (TDD & BDD)Familiarity with Functional ProgrammingArchitecting and developing APIsProficient understanding of Git, or other source code management systemsFamiliarity with CI/CD practices and toolsDesigning SQL complex statements







Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise

Familiarity with Cloud
Familiarity with Docker or similar container-based solutionsFamiliarity with Spark & Hadoop







About Business Unit

The IBM Finance organization is responsible for driving enterprise performance and transformation. We are the financial stewards of IBM, delivering IBM’s financial strategy, developing new business models, and mitigating enterprise risk. Do you have a passion for creating business value? Join our team in accounting, financial planning, pricing, business controls, tax, treasury, business development (acquisitions & divestitures), and global financing.



Your Life @ IBM

What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?



Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. About Us:

Epicor Software is a global technology leader dedicated to helping businesses drive growth for more than 45 years. Our modern, industry-specific software helps customers boost efficiency and productivity by simplifying and automating everyday processes. We have a stellar team of nearly 4,000 worldwide employees who are passionate about building exceptional products and solutions through teamwork, constant innovation, and integrity. We strive to hire and reward star players who inspire one another and drive results for the business and our customers.



About the Role:

We’re looking for a fantastic C#/.NET Developer to join our growing team. If you’re passionate and deeply curious about finding solutions to new challenges and perfecting the design of our visionary Epicor product suite, you could be the perfect fit for this role.



We’re seeking a candidate who has experience in developing solutions using C#, .NET Framework, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS). Does this sound like you? Good, keep reading.



What You’ll Do:

It’s all in the name. Develop our software products to make them the best in the industry.

Dream up and build new applications. Get creative and focus on solving problems for our customers

Write, test, and deploy code using established standards and procedures

Stay on track by following best practices and established processes for large, complex projects

Maintain, refine, and troubleshoot challenges with existing software to make sure it’s up to code (see what we did there?)



Writes, analyzes and implements detailed design specifications, provides feedback, and independently performs the work required.



Analyzes requirements as well as clarifies scope and breadth of work tasks with Info Systems Analysts or other members of IT.



Performs production support and data analysis to resolve issues, as well as manages tickets and supports end users.



Ability to occasionally work outside of standard business hours. We are a 24x7 global IT team and there is occasional after hours and weekend work.



Responds to requests for data or for data analysis including reporting, normalization, field mapping, and duplicate record detection using MS SQL.



Reviews quality assurance to validate work delivered and work quality.



Performs extensive data discovery and unit testing to ensure deployment of quality solutions early in the software development lifecycle.



What You Need to Succeed:

Amazing problem-solving skills

Collaborative team player with great communication.

Well-organized with high attention to detail, and an obsession with quality.



2-3 years of experience in application development that includes proficiency with Microsoft based software engineering (Visual Studio, .NET, C#, MVC, SSIS, SQL Server, Power shell). High level of working knowledge of relational databases such as MS SQL Server, creating DB objects, tables, indexes, views, constraints, etc.



2 years of experience with integration ETL tools such SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), including SSIS Script Tasks. Experience in designing systems that use C#, XML/XSLT, SOAP, REST, JSON.



Extensive experience with query tuning and developing stored procedures is required.



Exposure to both batch and real time system integration concepts. Ability to develop data translation objects and data processing flow using modern tools and adapt to new ones as they become available .



Experience with IT change management procedures, code promotion through non-production environments and source control management tool (GIT)



Additional Skills That Could Set You Apart:

Experience building front end user interfaces over complex table structures with .NET MVC or Blazor.



Experience with iPaaS cloud based tools like Jitterbit, Dell Boomi or similar.



Must be able to work effectively in a fluid, fast-paced agile environment. Experience using agile methodologies in practice (Scrum, Kanban).



Why you should click “Apply”:

This is an amazing opportunity for a C#/.NET Developer to join one of the top tech functions in our space, as we seek to push the boundaries of conventional ERP solutions with developments such as AI & IOT across the Microsoft stack and Azure cloud platform.

Understanding of specification systems and decision release systems.

The successful candidate will be flexible to the changing needs of the organisation; however areas of focus will include analysis, appraisal and recommendation of solutions in the commercial space. The role will involve performing Business Analysis as defined in the Role Responsibilities section. Project management skills will be a plus for any candidate.
Stakeholder Management:
Establishment of relationships with clients and members of project teams and liaise between the business and technical members of the project team, ensuring that client needs are clearly understood.
Act as an advocate for clients while simultaneously identifying areas (such as business process), that need to be changed within the business for project success.
Analysis and Solution Definition:
Performs project and enterprise business analysis or tasks collaboratively with the Client Partners and other Pfizer Digital teams. Tasks include: problem definition, define high-level business need/requirements, conduct capability gap assessment, identify potential solutions, complete feasibility studies, determine solution scope and defining business cases including outcome metrics and measurement methods. Must be familiar with the Request for Price (RFP) and Request for Information (RFI) processes within Pfizer.
Define the requirements gathering approach and change management plan for complex projects. Partners with other Pfizer Digital teams to manage the agreed deliverables. Working knowledge of Pfizer’s standard Statements of Works (SOW’s) template and processes are a requirement for this position.
Translates high-level functional requirements into detailed technical requirements. Establishes the requirements baseline and traces requirements throughout the project lifecycle. Ensures the solution meets business needs through benefits realization analysis or post implementation are reviews. Working knowledge of the Solutions Delivery Life Cycle (SDLC) is a requirement of the position.
In addition to possessing Business Analysis core skills, the successful candidate should have reasonable project management and software testing experience and will understand the overall context of their responsibilities in their assigned projects/programs. Working knowledge of the portfolio governance process (technology investment appraisal) will be an advantage.
Must seek to become subject matter experts on the processes and systems related to their assignments. Must have ability to create technical and training documentation as needed to support the regional and global Pfizer Digital organizations.
Project Execution :
The Business Analyst will be flexible and open to assisting in delivery of project deadlines and schedules. The Business Analyst will also run small scale projects according to the demand in the market.
Testing and Audit :
Assists or leads the effort in testing within Pfizer Digital projects. Develops use cases and test scripts that include effective test metrics. Ensures that issues are identified, tracked, reported on and resolved in a timely manner. Works with client representation to identify required changes. Working knowledge of Pfizer’s internal audit processes and of the Information Protection and Risk Management (IPRM) framework is an advantage in this position.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree or similar in Science, Engineering or Business-related discipline is a minimum requirement.
Significant experience in Information Technology or in the Pharmaceutical/life sciences industry is preferred.
Technically oriented analytical mindset
Experience of applying industry standard business analysis approaches
Fluency in written and oral business English is essential
Experience of data analysis and modelling
Effective communicator
PHYSICAL/MENTAL REQUIREMENTS
Ability to perform complex data analysis and modeling
NON-STANDARD WORK SCHEDULE, TRAVEL OR ENVIRONMENT REQUIREMENTS
Digital & Technology is a 7x24x365 operation. This role may require occasional physical or virtual participation on a weekend, holiday, or after normal business hours.


Some travel maybe required – approx. 5%
Pfizer is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction in which it operates.

Trax is seeking a talented Project Manager to join our dedicated, passionate team of technology professionals. We value motivated, savvy, roll-up-the-sleeves type of operators who are not afraid to get into the details but can also effectively manage all levels of customer conversation. This role is critical to the success of Trax.
The Project Manager will report to either the Head of Operations or a Project Director (depending on the customer and project) and will be responsible for ensuring excellent new project deployments through seamless internal and external coordination, customer expectation management, relationship building, and operational delivery (within agreed upon SLAs and timelines). The PM is the face of Trax operations to our customer and a pivotal piece to long-term customer and project success.
This role is preferably in one of Trax’s Latin America hubs – Mexico City or Sao Paulo, Brazil.
Mission of the Role
Trax aims to be the single point of information for all things in store. We aim to be a reliable, consistent, customer-centric team who delivers the highest quality data and enables our partners to effectively navigate an increasingly complex retail environment.
The role of the PM is a critical to shaping the customer’s first experience with Trax. This builds their perception of our company and their understanding of image recognition as a solution (and all operational components to deliver it successfully). The PM will coordinate all pieces of the delivery routine over a 3-12 month project life cycle and align all internal and external parties in the process. They will set the stage for long-term operational success and excellent ongoing service delivery.

Requirements:



Background in an operational or customer success-related role is a must (CPG background is a plus).Experience managing a team, process or roll out for a customer. You must be able to showcase your ability to orient a large group to execute a project, cross-functional goal or program effectively.Experience working with remote teams in different time zones.Customer-facing experience required (on-site a plus).Experience navigating all levels of stakeholders - from day to day analysts to senior level executives.Fluent in English + Spanish is a must. Portuguese is a plus.

Responsibilities:



Leadership and Coordination:Create and centralize a deployment project plan, holding all internal and external stakeholders accountable for quality and on-time delivery across project milestones.Lead projects cross-regionally, for LATAM and/or US markets as required.Oversee the coordination and collaboration of all Trax services teams to meet project milestones.Educate the Customer on Trax processes, simplifying their experience and perception of working with Trax as a partner.Work closely with Support/Product/R&D on release management, proactively communicating service and technology changes to customer (leading UAT with customer before changes occur).Similarly, coordinate issue resolution across functions if/when issues occur.Set up key KPIs to track project health and customer satisfaction.Share and utilize best practices across other regional Project Managers.Work together with Account Managers to create and maintain positive working relationship with the customer, ensuring Trax business understands customer must-haves and pain points.
Operational Delivery:Meet customer project milestones (planning, UAT, go-live, etc.) in accordance to aligned upon project plan.Track and resolve all issues and mitigate risks that present themselves in the project, during project setup and optimization stages.Create playbook for “live” customer operations (when the project has deployed) to transition to Business as Usual operations team.Prioritize and elevate relevant customer issues within Trax Support team.Monitor ongoing performance against customer KPIs.Lead project stabilization efforts where necessary (to move project statuses to “green”).

City:


Mexico City

The Business


Willis Towers Watson’s Global Services and Solutions (GSS) team is dedicated to serving the needs of the headquarters of its multinational clients. Operating in the global market place means multinational companies face a variety of different business, cultural, language and regulatory environments. Our GSS helps these companies navigate these challenges. We advise multinational companies on certain specialist topics where the GSS has unique experience, but we also act as a single point of contact to help solve client questions where we draw on the expertise of our colleagues from around the world.


Within GSS, we group our services into the following main areas:


Multi-country coordination and project management
We provide advice and coordination for global projects including for example:
Benefits inventory, benchmarking against market practice and compliance
Global broking and other benefits procurement activity


Advice around the management of employee benefits
We provide advice to headquarters on the most efficient management of their employee benefits. Examples might include:
Supporting global oversight and governance procedures
Co-sourcing of benefits management
Health & wellbeing strategies


GSS Analysts work across borders in international teams supporting multinational organizations


The Role
This role will entail supporting our international clients in the delivery of consulting services to the headquarters and coordination of local consulting services relating to employee benefits. Key tasks associated with this role will be to:


Provide data analytics, draft reports and presentations, update project trackers and work with the local country consultants and brokers to obtain status updates.
Manage the clients’ benefits data which includes working with the Global Benefits Center to populate data and being responsible that data is accurate and updated on a timely basis.Facilitate and coordinate initial technology and implementation tasks upon project start up.
Support the use of Willis Towers Watson’s proprietary technology including Benefits Insights, Benefits Data Source, BenVals and other tools to help clients to maximize the value from the information collected,
Support the global consulting lead, global project manager, and local/regional country consultants to deliver advice to the headquarters of our multinational clients on employee benefit matters around the world.
Coordinate and manage multi-country projects such as: global benefit benchmarking exercises, cost savings projects and governance processes.
Keep abreast of changes in legislation, market practice or otherwise, to identify issues that clients should be addressing.


The Requirements


We are looking for candidates with:
Proficiency in English (written and spoken) is a must
Experience with employee benefits or insurance market is a plus.
A keen interest in the International benefits arena.
Self-motivation and the ability to work effectively in teams, including remotely with colleagues in other countries.
Ability to work with project management tools and attention to details
Analytical and problem solving skills
Strong desire to deliver to clients’ high quality results, consistently and a proactive approach to working with clients.
A keen desire to learn.
The ability to use Excel to manipulate and analyze data, as well as a working knowledge of Microsoft PowerPoint and Microsoft Word.
Availability to travel to the United States

We are seeking a Business Analyst leading the Strategic Services Practice Large Deal Methodology Team as part of CX Centers in Customer Experience (CX).

The Strategic Services Engine serves to lead delivery of custom CX Center services, increase partner confidence in CX Centers, shift more work to Centers, incubate innovation to scale, and introduce standardization (repeatability, automations) resulting in outstanding P/L and transition of work to Proactive Services.

More specifically, the Engine scope includes Delivery Strategy (Delivery Methodology, Prioritization, Roadmaps), Demand & Expectation Management, Escalation Management, Performance Management, Continuous Service Improvement, Financial / Cost Management, Relationship Management, and Sales & Marketing Support.

For decades Cisco's vision has been to change the way we work, live, play and learn. The LDM team is extending that vision making it easier, and more profitable, to achieve the forward-thinking changes that customers need now. Come build the new methodology improving CX Centers' strength and make Cisco's largest deals more successful!

The Strategic Services Engine is organized into Lines of Business and the Practice. The lines of business focus on the content. As the Business Analyst, you will:

Complete pre- and post-Sales planning with CX Region leaders/Sales/BDMs including staffing level of effort, min/max cost structures, blue/red/managed service delivery mix

Provide per-deal budget guidance (with timing) to the CX Center Regions, CX Regions, Ops, and Finance

Engage with Vertical Lead, Sales and CX Region and provide guidance on aspects like return on investment, market trends, business proposal structuring standard methodologies etc.

Engage with Vertical Lead and CX Region to understand customer vision and present guidance related to approach methodologies and opportunity assessment.

Define, analyze, simplify and document requirements to map a business problem into a use case. Engage with the SDA to convert the use case into a technical solution.

Assist business functions with data analysis for business/value case development for key strategic initiatives.

Conduct deep analysis of various attributes (e.g., product, technology, sentiment, segment, business entity, customer) to determine key drivers.

Among the qualifications for this role, emphasis is placed on your ability to understand business and technical solutions for a key vertical (one of Government and Utilities; Financials; Healthcare, Manufacturing, Logistics, and Retail; OR Service Provider and Technical Services) and optimize Cisco’s CX Centers ability to deliver those solutions profitably. Who You'll Work With

Cisco CX Centers is force multiplier for Cisco and our partners to simplify digital transformation for our customers through unmatched technical expertise, relevant insights, and relentless automation at global scale

In the CX Center organizational design, there are 3 functions: Regions, Engines, and Foundations. This Business Analyst role is aligned to the Strategic Services Engine. Engines are expected to:

Design, own and implement global delivery methodology for Engine with visibility to regional differences

Own disruption and innovation including business cases to take innovation to scale

Ensure Delivery Readiness for new & changed offers (working with CXPM & BUs)

Actively monitor high quality service delivery and initiate process/tooling improvements Who You Are

Experienced technical expert (Solution Architect or Technical Leader)

Naturally inquisitive

Strong communicator

Willing to innovate



Influential Our minimum requirements are the following:

You've achieved a Bachelor degree; Masters’ preferred.

Have 5+ years’ experience in designing cost efficient solutions to resolve customer challenges and ensure a good ROI.

You have a demonstrated ability to negotiate and influence actions of team members outside of function for improved team and service performance

You can identify, prioritize and deliver measurable results using frameworks and sound business practices, understanding cross-functional dependencies

You are analytical with a strong ability to translate insights into recommendations and actions.

Strong business and technical writing skills, coupled with strong presentation abilities

You love teamwork, collaboration and have well-developed project management skills

You possess advanced Leadership Skills including leading by influence Why Cisco

#WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference. Here’s how we do it.

We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (30 years strong!) And only about hardware, but we’re also a software company, security company, a blockchain company, and a AI/Machine Learning company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!

But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)

Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, we give our egos a break, and we give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and we difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.

So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!

Cisco is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.

titulo: Compl Surveillance Analyst 2 – Mexico Trade Surveillance
descripcion:
Serves as a compliance risk analyst for Independent Compliance Risk Management (ICRM)’s Surveillance team responsible for the design, implementation, and oversight for a suite of surveillances designed to detect behaviors that may violate regulatory rules or internal policies and procedures. When potentially anomalous behavior is detected, the team is responsible for escalating the activity and working collaboratively with partners across the first and second lines of defense to determine the appropriate resolution of the matter, which may include employee discipline. . The ICRM Global Surveillance platform encompasses a number of surveillance related portfolios including trade surveillance, e-communications and voice surveillance, employee trading, outside activities surveillance, and information barrier surveillance.



Responsibilities:
Assisting team members with the reviewing and analyzing of surveillance alerts and/or reports relating to firm, employee and client trading activity. Properly documenting the review and disposition of the exceptions as well as escalating matters appropriately.
Gathering and analyzing trade data to assist in the Firm’s response to inquiries received from governmental and exchange regulatory bodies. Supporting the compliance group in evaluating surveillance results for potential problems, communicating surveillance findings to management in a clear and concise manner as well as interacting with legal and other compliance personnel.
Responding to inquiries or requests from internal partners (e.g. ICRM Assurance, Internal Audit, and Legal).
Assisting with the design and implementation of new surveillances as well as the refinement of existing ones.
Other responsibilities include handling telephone hotlines and performing data entry.
Additional duties as assigned
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Qualifications:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Must be a self-starter, flexible, innovative and adaptive
Demonstrated interpersonal skills with the ability to work collaboratively and with people at all levels of the organization
Proven project management and organizational skills and capability to handle multiple projects at one time
Proficient in MS Office applications (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
Knowledge of Compliance laws, rules, regulations, risks and typologies
Some knowledge in area of focus
Education:
Bachelor’s degree; experience in a financial services firm, regulatory organization, or legal/consulting firm, or a combination thereof, Advanced degree preferred

You're the brains behind our work.

You’re ready to bring your knowledge from the classroom to the boardroom and Banamex / Citi wants to help you get there. Whether it’s honing your skills or building your network, we know that success can’t come without growth. Our programs equip you with the knowledge and training you need to play a valuable role on your team, and establish a long-term career here.

At Banamex / Citi, we value internal mobility, and career growth is not a question of if, but when. Banamex / Citi Mexico is looking for full-time Analysts to join the Citi Commercial Banking (CCB) team. CCB works with companies who have annual sales ranging from $100 million to $500,000 million (MxP). As a member of the CCB team, your job will be to find ways for our clients to maximize their wealth growth while taking full advantage of Banamex banking products. That means knowing all about our financial products and services; you’re advocating for both sides—an ambassador for Citi and the clients you work with.



Your time here will look something like this...


Utilize formal training in practical applications supporting business needs such as credit risk analysis, product/service operations, customer focus and sales
Company research and industry analysis
Collecting and analyzing company information to assist transactions, including conducting industry research, revising, and organizing financial data
Valuation analysis/modelling
Analyzing financial data, using and developing financial models, including company valuations, discounted cash flow analysis, financing, comparative, and pro-formal analyses
Creating and finalizing new business development presentations
Project coordination
Preparing required internal documentation e.g. control and compliance regulations

We provide you with the knowledge and skills you need to succeed.

We’re committed to teaching you the ropes. The Commercial Banking Program trains and grows key players in today’s changing economic environment. The program objective is to create a pipeline of Commercial Relationship Bankers who have a strong foundation in sales and commercial credit analysis. The six-month Analyst Program starts in June and begins with a two-month training in accounting, credit/risk, sales, product, technology and financial analysis to acquire the skills necessary to structure commercial deals and analyze credit risk. You will learn how to analyze financial statements, risk portfolios and credit transactions. After a placement process based on your interests and our business needs, you will be matched with a Commercial Banking team (Risk Analyst, CMO or Investment Executive) to work with for the next 12 to 18 months. At the end of the training program, you will be eligible to become a Commercial Relationship Banker.



We want to hear from you if...


You are in your final year of university or you have obtained a Bachelor’s degree in Business Management, Economics, Sales/Marketing, or General Studies, with a strong finance focus • Ideally you possess a working knowledge of accounting fundamentals and have prior work experience gained through summer internships, full time work, and/or school activities

Who we think will be a great fit...

If you are highly motivated and results-oriented, the Commercial Banking Program is a great step forward in your career. Extensive work experience is not a requirement, but dedication to learning and a true passion for the business are vital. As industries all over the globe continue to restructure and grow, we are hiring professionals who have a global perspective on the future of banking, and want to make an impact on the corporate level. We value diversity and so do you.



We’ll also be looking for the following:


Ability to work both independently as well as in a team
Organizational skills, a high degree of self-motivation, initiative, and leadership potential
Ability to prepare the analysis and materials for a meeting with the CEO of a high-profile company, while exhibiting professionalism and insight throughout their interaction with the client
Strong communication, interpersonal, and relationship-building skills
Innovative and creative problem-solving ability
Intellectually curious and willing to ask questions
Cooperation and focus in achieving group and client objectives
English proficiency

#About Ironhack
Ironhack is an education startup that was founded to disrupt the way tech education works!


Doesn’t it seem odd that we’ve been learning the same way since the Industrial Revolution? Virtually all industries are pushing the limits on how to do things faster, better, and more efficiently. Yet, for the most part, people feel stuck on a 4+ year (and usually quite expensive) path that often results in an unfulfilling career path.


We empower students to create a new path - one that leads to meaningful careers in software development, product design or data analytics in a fraction of the time and cost of traditional education.


Our higher purpose is to transform the education space to be unapologetically outcomes-driven. Whether students are looking to change careers, get a promotion, skip University, or start their own company, we work tirelessly every day to make sure this path is as quick, immersive, and accessible as possible. Hearing these success stories is what gets us out of bed each day, excited to come to work :)


It’s with this mindset that we’ve become one of the key global players in bridging the digital skills gap, serving both those looking to get into tech, as well as the companies hungry for tech talent.


Quick facts:Founded in 2013 by Wharton and Harvard gradsOperations in Miami, Madrid, Barcelona, Paris, Mexico City, Lisbon, Amsterdam, Sao Paulo and Berlin100% YoY Growth (help us to keep it going!)Graduated over 6500 students100+ global team membersVenture capital backed

About Verité:


Verité is an Amherst-based nonprofit and award-winning pioneer in the social auditing, training, research, and


consulting field. The organization has over 20 years of experience working with Fortune 500 corporations and their local


suppliers through our global network of NGO partners. Verité works in over 70 countries to empower companies,


factories, NGOs, governments, and workers to create sustainable workplace practices in the factories and communities


where our consumer goods are made and the raw materials that go into them are sourced. For more information, please


visit https://www.verite.org.




Internship:


Verité interns work on a variety of research projects addressing forced labor, human trafficking, and human rights


abuses worldwide. Interns will perform desk research, various administrative tasks, draft reports, and proofread texts.


Research interns will read and analyze reports published by the U.S. Department of State, the U.S. Department of Labor,


and the International Labour Organization (ILO) and become familiar with the work of these entities as well as the work


of many different stakeholders. Interns will support our work with brands and our large-scale federally-funded research


projects by conducting desk research on and analyzing supply chains, sectors, and commodities. Interns may assist on a


number of Verité projects and are not limited to only the projects detailed below.




Start date: Negotiable; beginning of Winter/Spring semester


End date: Negotiable; end of Spring semester


Interns are expected to work 8 – 10 hours per week during the semester for 10 – 12 weeks (for a total of 80 – 120


hours). Exact start and end dates and hours are negotiable as long as those criteria are met. Due to the COVID-19


pandemic, all internships are currently remote.




Verité offers interns a modest stipend in the amount of $250 for the duration of the session to offset any cost of living


and/or travel expenses. If your school also provides either funding or academic credits for intern work, Verité is happy to


assist with the required paperwork. We also provide opportunities to interact with senior staff, mentoring, networking


assistance, and references upon successful completion of the internship.




Skills, abilities, and competencies:
Ability to find, evaluate, analyze, and summarize a wide range of complex source materials
Ability to meet deadlines, prioritize assigned tasks, and work independently, all with an attention to detail
Excellent writing skills
Proactive approach to assignments
Previous knowledge of (or interest in/willingness to learn quickly) issues related to countries and regions of
focus, relevant regulatory frameworks, human trafficking, and/or corporate responsibility efforts


Familiarity with organizing datasets a plus
Reading fluency/competency in any of the following languages a plus: Arabic, Bahasa, Bengali, Burmese,
Chinese, Filipino, French, Hindi, Khmer, Korean, Mandarin, Nepalese, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish, Swahili,


Tamil, Thai, Turkish, Urdu, Vietnamese
Demonstrates professional competency and/or personal experience thinking and working effectively across
boundaries*
Demonstrates sensitivity and competency engaging with the diverse marginalized populations impacted by
Verité’s mission



These include, but are not limited to: gender, race, religion, age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status,
pregnancy status, nationality, class, political opinion, union affiliation, or social or ethnic origin.




Verité is committed to a diverse work force and is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate against any


employee, intern, or applicant for employment or internship on the basis of race, ethnicity, national origin, age, sex,


sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, class, religion, veteran status, ability, and any other federal, state, or


locally protected classes.




How to Apply:


Please provide cover letter, resume, and academic writing sample of 3-5 pages to verite@verite.org. Multilingual


applicants may be asked to provide a writing sample in additional languages. Use subject line: “Verité Winter/Spring


2021 Internship.” If you have an interest in one of the specific projects outlined below, please address it in your cover


letter. Any questions can be directed to Yamila Irizarry-Gerould at verite@verite.org.


Projects

 

Partnership for Slavery-Free Supply Chains: Verité is currently working on a philanthropically-funded project to


create a labor broker risk screening tool that will enable companies to unravel complex labor supply chains and


identify risks of human trafficking and forced labor within them. The initial stage of the pilot focused on electronics


production in Southeast Asia and has since expanded into additional industries and geographic areas. Verité


continues to conduct original research on labor brokers and their practices in Argentina, Bahrain, Brazil, Egypt, Italy,


Japan, Jordan, Malaysia, Mexico, Poland, Qatar, Singapore, South Korea, Taiwan, Thailand, United Arab Emirates


(UAE), and the United States of America (USA). This data is integrated with corporate supply chain data, analyzed,


and visualized on a data analytics platform to give an unprecedented look at the source of forced labor risk in these


sectors and regions. Intern tasks include:
o Performing targeted desk research in a variety of languages, to develop profiles for a set of labor brokers


and their practices in each country of focus, using a wide variety of sources including academic, corporate,


business, NGO, media, and government reports
o Organizing findings using reporting templates and assisting analysts in inputting the gathered information


into a database
o Engaging in new software feature research, testing and documentation to assist the product team in


maintaining an efficient project workflow
o Assisting in project-specific administrative activities including customer service, metrics gathering and


analysis, and survey progress monitoring
o Individuals with fluency in certain languages, especially Mandarin, may provide translation assistance for


documents, correspondence, and research tools. Those with language skills in Thai, Malay, or Arabic, closely


followed by Italian or Spanish, are also encouraged to apply.
 Responsible Sourcing Tool: In 2016, Verité launched the Responsible Sourcing Tool (RST), providing a resource to


federal contractors to meet the anti-trafficking compliance measures in the Federal Acquisition Regulation. In


addition to federal contractors, the interactive website helps companies, advocates, and consumers detect, prevent,


and combat trafficking in global supply chains and meet the growing number of legal, regulatory, and market


demands for attention to severe exploitation in global supply chains. The website currently contains extensive


research on 11 key sectors and 43 commodities at risk for trafficking or trafficking-related activities, ten


comprehensive risk management tools, case studies, and links to guidance from other expert organizations. Intern


tasks include:
o Desk research and media scans on specific commodities and sectors


o Report drafting and updating


o Data-related work (trade and export data, organizing data in certain platforms, updating data and quality
assurance)


o Support development of new sector-specific tools
 China Worker Well-being Project: This program is designed to change how workers are taught the key compliance


subjects (focusing on labor rights and health and safety) in China’s vocational schools, with a direct link to on-going


training and empowerment mechanisms in their post-school workplace life. Interns would work in cooperation with


the Grant Program Manager based in China, the China office Director, and other Verité staff. Intern tasks include:
o Perform targeted desk research and data/information/material collection in English and Chinese


o Conduct preliminary/basic analysis of survey and evaluation results


o Provide translation assistance for documents, correspondence and tools as (between English and Chinese)


o Assist Program Manager in organizing and inputting the gathered information into a database


o Assist in drafting and formatting of communication leaflets/reports/training materials/surveys


o Other tasks as required by Program Manager and China Director




o Occasional calls or check-ins outside of office hours may be required, due to the time difference with our
China office

 

Worker Empowerment (WE) Project: One of Verité’s goals is to empower workers to advocate for their own rights.


The worker empowerment program is a committee within Verité working to develop the organization’s position on


worker empowerment, freedom of association, and trade union rights. It seeks to build internal capacity and


expertise on worker empowerment through the development of a WE catalogue, business cases, and an impact


measurement plans, to integrate WE components into Verité’s different workstreams, programs, and initiatives, and


to establish products and services and business development strategies and plans accordingly. Interns tasks might


include the following:
o Review Verité’s existing WE program documents


o Catalogue documents/resources based on a classification framework provided by the WE working group


o Contribute to the development of WE products and service offerings
 Research & Data: The Research and Data intern will be responsible for maintaining the statistical content in the


Africa microsite on our website. The work will involve pulling in new numbers from publicly available published


datasets and manipulating them to generate updated charts. The project will also involve desk research to update


written content on the site to match the new charts, and to update narrative information about key commodities


and countries. This intern will also assist and support our Raw Materials programming more generally. Skills,


abilities, and competencies for this internship include:
o Attention to detail


o Excellent English-language writing and editing skills


o Basic interest in statistics and data analysis


o A designer’s eye and a writer’s mastery of grammar and copyediting


o Familiarity with Microsoft Office Suite


o Interest in Sub-Saharan Africa preferred, and proficiency with Infogram and/or WordPress or other content
management systems a plus

 

Monitoring & Evaluation: Verité is in the process of building organization-wide systems for measuring the broader


performance and impact of our work across departments. This internship will support Verité’s M&E efforts at an


organizational level—an exciting opportunity for anyone interested in both organizational strategy and the


complexities of impact measurement in the human rights sector. Candidates should be able to take initiative and


work independently. Familiarity with basic M&E concepts is preferred. Intern tasks may involve the following:
o Participate in Verité’s internal Performance and Impact Team and support the development of an


organizational impact framework.
o Research qualitative methodologies for measuring organizational impact indicators.


o Support the creation of guidance materials that promote systematic performance and impact data
collection.


o Meet with Verité staff to help document organizational success stories related to our advocacy efforts,
worker empowerment initiatives, and private sector engagements.


o Support the drafting of external communications on Verité’s impact.
 Ghana Forced Labor Indicators Project (FLIP): Verité is currently implementing a U.S. Department of Labor-funded


project focused on growing government, private sector, trade union, and civil society capacity to combat forced


labor of adults and children through advancing the ILO forced labor indicators approach in Ghana. The Ghana Forced


Labor Indicators Project (FLIP) focuses on the gold, cocoa, and palm oil sectors and has three main objectives:
1. Develop a shared understanding of the precise nature of forced labor and trafficking in Ghana and how the


forced labor indicator approach can be utilized in support of this understanding;
2. Collaborate with stakeholders to support integrating the forced labor indicators approach into existing labor


monitoring efforts; and




3. Further capacitate the labor inspectorate and other key government actors in recognizing, documenting,
and addressing forced labor and labor trafficking and the risk factors and indicators it encompasses.


Ghana FLIP intern tasks may include:
o Supporting development of training curriculum and materials


o Desk research


o Stakeholder mapping


o Data cleaning and input


o Potential work in French
 Evidence to Action: Increasing the Impact of Research to Mobilize Efforts against Forced Labor: Verité is an


implementing partner for a multi-year project to increase knowledge and mobilize stakeholders regarding forced


labor in the garment sector in Argentina and Mauritius. The project will provide significant new information


regarding the nature and causes of forced labor within the garment and associated textile sectors of Mauritius and


Argentina; will build the capacity of national research institutions, government and civil society organizations to


undertake and use research to prevent, identify, and combat forced labor; will provide globally relevant examples


and assessment of tools for the investigation of forced labor; and will catalyze a broad group of stakeholders to act


on the research findings, making the link from data to policy. Verité is seeking two interns to aid with the rapid


appraisal phase of the project, with special focus on Argentina and Mauritius. Activities for this work may include:
o Desk research


o Database creation and maintenance, data collection, and possibly geospatial analysis of publicly available
information.


o Stakeholder mapping: identifying key stakeholders for interview, assisting in interview preparation, and
recording or organizing notes from expert interviews.


Intern qualifications should include:
o For the intern focusing on Argentina:


o Fluent or advanced language proficiency in both English and Spanish


o Currently pursuing an undergraduate or advanced degree in relevant fields, with preference for
specializations in Latin America


o Optional: Knowledge or interest in geospatial analysis and data visualization software
o For the intern focusing on Mauritius:


o Fluent or advanced language proficiency in both English and French


o Currently pursuing an undergraduate or advanced degree in relevant fields, such as political science,
economics, or public policy.

Trinity Corporate IT is searching for a talented team player to fill the open position of Financial Business Systems Analyst in our Queretaro, Mexico office. This role will serve as a member of IT’s business-facing team and will be responsible for the full application development lifecycle, operational performance of our ERP systems (Financial), and overall maintenance and support.
The Financial Business and Systems Analyst role requires building and maintaining relationships with business stakeholders; understanding of business processes; ability to work with cross-functional teams; strong technical abilities within application design, support, develop, configure and implement changes of ERP systems; basic project management skills; and strong communication skills. The role will interface with multiple departments and Business Units including Corporate Office and Manufacturing Plants in US and Mexico.


What you’ll do:
Support, develop, configure and implement changes of ERP systems and other applications that support Finance and Accounting business processes. Activities include:
Work with business stakeholders to understand business processes and elicit, define, and analyze business requirements.
Collaborate with functional and technical teams across all ERP modules and other applications to define and design proposed solutions that meet business requirements and adhere to application design guidelines, strategies, and best practices.
Create deliverables according to the Software Development Lifecycle such as functional and technical specifications, use cases, test cases, and system documentation.
Facilitate resolution of cross-team business issues.
Collaborate with business partners on deployment including training, change management, and communications.
Create test cases to cover business processes and system functions; execute tests; analyze and resolve defects.
Apply project management standards and concepts; prepare work estimates and work schedules; create and update project plans.
Support production systems; proactively work to analyze and resolve production problems in a timely manner. Resolve end user service requests.
Identify opportunities to leverage applications to improve business processes, and support business improvement efforts.

What you’ll need:
BA/BS in Business, Finance, Accounting or technical discipline
5+ years’ experience supporting ERP, vendor or custom financial solutions that are impacted by financial month or quarter-end closes
Functional knowledge and project experience working with Financial ERP systems(Infor LX or BPCS preferred/knowledge of Oracle is a plus
Working knowledge of software maintenance lifecycle to include production support, patching,/upgrades, infrastructure and enhancements
Solid consultative and relationship building skills
Working knowledge of organizational change implications on system functionality
Business case/benefits case development expertise
3 years’ business process design experience focusing on process improvement
Financial reporting experience to include Transactional Inventory Reporting, Currency Translation, General Ledger, Costing, Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, and Physical Inventory
Strong knowledge of Mexico Accounting Legal Requirements and Inventory Management business processes and Industry and Process Best Practice
Must have prior experience in manufacturing environments including supporting plant users directly
Bilingual – English / Spanish
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and determine valid conclusions
Highly preferred: Experience supporting an ERP upgrade or deployment
Highly preferred: External, customer-facing, business consulting experience
Knowledge of the Systems Development Life Cycle process (SDLC); and Waterfall or Agile/Scrum methodologies
Must be familiar with project management tools
Well organized, and self-motivated
Effective communication and presentation skills are vital
Familiarity with Sarbanes-Oxley, Mexico SAT Reporting requirements and general audit requirements

Job Description:
Are you an avid problem solver? Can you work independently as well as collaborate with a team? Are you looking for a challenging, fun, fast-paced environment to exercise and hone your skills? If so, you might be a great fit for Skyworks!
We need a hands-on SAP SD Functional Analyst with focus on Logistics Execution.
Responsibilities:
As a Principal Business Analyst, you will be part of the Enterprise systems team responsible for analyzing, designing, building and maintaining our Sales and Distribution applications with focus on shipping process. Additionally, you will work closely with the end-users and their management to improve processes and workflows. You will be challenged with identifying Innovative ideas and proof of concepts to deliver against the existing and future needs of our customers.
Support SAP applications involved in “Order to Cash” process
Assist business partners with creating requirements, identifying gaps and formulating business requirements into technical solutions.
Create Functional Specifications based on business requirements and work with development team to deliver solutions
Maintain a holistic view of all business system processes and users, to understand functional impacts regarding configuration, process, workflow and reporting.
Support the integration of the next gen systems with the existing Business Application ecosystem (e.g. SAP, Custom .NET applications, SQL server data warehouse etc.).
Validate software quality and conformance to specifications and business requirements through unit-functional testing; and Identify the root cause of defects.
Work with management, Project Managers, Business Users and development team to scope work and schedule estimates.

Requirements:
BS in Computer Science or related field is required.
Minimum 8 years of experience in supporting enterprise applications
2-3 years of experience in supporting SAP SD (Order to Cash) systems
2-3 years of experience in supporting shipping applications
Experience working with SQL queries/procedures a must.
Experience working with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) is a must.
Experience working with SAP IDOCs is preferred.
Good understanding of supply chain process is preferred.

BENEFICIOS

En BBVA proporcionamos a nuestros colaboradores las mejores condiciones para su desarrollo y bienestar integral, al sumarte a nuestro equipo tendrás grandes beneficios:

 60 días de aguinaldo, 15 días de vacaciones y prima vacacional superior a la de la ley.
