 Plan de carrera y desarrollo.


Acerca de la Dirección de Banca Corporativa y de Inversión
La Dirección General de Banca Corporativa y de Inversión, es una pieza clave dentro del Grupo BBVA México, en donde participamos como un solo equipo, junto con las demás Direcciones Generales, aportando valor atendiendo al segmento de empresas más grandes de México. Nuestra principal responsabilidad reside en desarrollar la relación del banco con nuestros clientes asesorándolos en sus necesidades de riesgos financieros, fondeo y estrategias de crecimiento.
Aspectos generales
Sobre el área
El área de BPE se encarga de desarrollar una visión estratégica del estado de los procesos de CIB con altos niveles de eficiencia, control y calidad del servicio prestado a los clientes.
Sobre el rol
Funciones Principales: Análisis de Ios de los proceso End to End de CIB para identificar y atender áreas de oportunidad e implementar mejoras en el procedimiento To Be. Identificar riesgos dentro de los procesos y controles que los mitigan. Adaptación y/o cambios en políticas para simplificar y agilizar los procesos. Participar en proyectos de la SDA en los roles SCRUM: Team member bajo metodologías agile.

Responsabilidades: Participar en proyectos de la SDA en los roles SCRUM: Team member bajo metodologías agile. Conocer manejo de hojas de trabajo (ejemplo DATA STUDIO) generar KPI´s Crear cuadros de gestión de procesos para las diversas áreas.

Retos del Puesto: Reto: comunicación. Generar y mantener una muy buena comunicación con los clientes internos. Adaptabilidad a diversos estilos de trabajo. (Generacionales).
Trabajar en BBVA
BBVA es una empresa global con más de 160 años de historia que opera en más de 30 países en los que damos servicio a más de 79 millones de clientes. Somos más de 125.000 profesionales que trabajamos en equipos multidisciplinares y diversos.




En BBVA estamos a la cabeza de la transformación que se está produciendo en el sector bancario, cuestionando lo establecido, para hacer la vida más fácil a nuestros clientes.




Formar parte de BBVA significa desarrollar tu carrera en la empresa que lidera la transformación del sector financiero.
Banca responsable
Nuestro modelo de banca responsable aspira a lograr una sociedad más inclusiva y sostenible. Porque el futuro de las finanzas es financiar el futuro.



Empezamos con el espíritu de ayudar a otros a tomar las mejores decisiones financieras. Ese espíritu permanece hoy en día y nos anima a seguir avanzando, dando prioridad a la innovación y a la transformación digital y poner al alcance de todos las oportunidades de esta nueva era.
Diversidad
En BBVA creemos que contar con un equipo diverso, nos hace ser un mejor banco.



Por este motivo apoyamos activamente la diversidad, la inclusión y la igualdad de oportunidades sin importar cual sea su raza, sexo, edad, religión o condición sexual, cultivamos un ambiente de trabajo colaborativo e inclusivo que nos permita mostrar lo mejor de nosotros mismos.
Nuestros valores
Nuestros valores definen nuestra identidad y son la palanca que nos impulsan a hacer realidad nuestro propósito y nos guían en todas nuestras acciones y decisiones.
El cliente es lo primero
Pensamos en grande
Somos un solo equipo

Company Details:
At Cubic we’re changing the way people travel – to work, to school, to wherever they want or need to go, and home again. Come join our team of data & analytics experts as we build innovative technologies and leverage the advanced data science techniques to tackle transportation’s most pressing challenges. As a global company our work impacts the lives of millions of people around the world in cities like London, New York, Sydney, and many more. Cubic Data & Analytics team is the analytics center of excellence across Cubic, and we are using data to optimize transit networks, reduce road congestion, improve the travel experience, and minimize each city’s carbon footprint.




You will collaborate with a diverse group of talented professionals who are as passionate about their work as you are, and are committed to delivering only the highest quality solutions. We are an agile team and this means you’re empowered to deliver the best results, have the opportunity to influence all aspects of the business, and know that each contribution you make is significant. In an industry where Cubic is a world leader, we’re driving a paradigm shift in how transportation services are planned, delivered, and consumed to better meet the needs of an increasing and ever-more concentrated urban population. Don’t take a backseat. Join Cubic’s Data & Analytics team and be instrumental in driving the future of travel.
Job Details:
Job Summary: Incumbents of position will be responsible for designing, building, and optimizing data pipelines to expand the capabilities and products delivered by our analytics platform. Must be comfortable interfacing and supporting multiple teams and working with product managers, data engineers, data scientists, business analysts, and project managers, at different regional offices across the globe. The ideal candidate has a passion for data, significant experience building production level data pipelines, and enjoys working in a self-directed semi-structured environment. Incumbents of this position will regularly exercise discretionary and substantial decision-making authority.
Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Filter, clean, and prepare large data sets for more advanced transformations
Perform statistical analyses, develop new performance metrics, benchmarks, and indices
Develop and document new data models, ERDs, schemas, and data workflows
Validate and quality control produced data sets
Research, interpret, and perform quantitative analysis against transportation data on topics such as urban mobility, land use, growth management, demographic studies, economic development, and housing
Collaborate with project teams to develop new reporting and analysis tools and workflows
Analyze client information needs and business challenges to determine how they may be addressed through the delivery of decision support tools and services
Apply understanding of global and local trends and events to assist with the formulation of hypotheses and interpretation of data
Stay current with technical and industry developments, analytics software/tools, and recognized best practices
Analyzing, profiling, documenting data warehouses
Writing technical documentation and business documents
Build configurable, parametrized, scalable, robust pipelines/ETL workflows
Scraping, data ingestion and data integration from multiple sources and databases, including web APIs, Protobuf feeds, SQL databases
Data exploration with Tableau, PowerBI
End-to-end pipeline QA
Feature extraction and generation
Using Python to clean data, extract features, and build models using packages such as scikit-learn, numpy, pandas

Database design, schema definition, and database optimization
Experience building elastic, scalable APIs
Experience developing in an Agile environment
Familiar with cloud computing, Azure and/or AWS, PaaS, IaaS
Experience developing Python scripts

Now we are looking for this position:




Data Analyst




Main Purpose


The Technology Business Management (TBM) Analyst for Service Management Data and systems Integration will focus on defining TBM IT towers and services data model meeting cost transparency requirements, ensuring availability of related operational & billing data, and maturing these data throughout the implementation and on an ongoing basis. This role will also be responsible for overall integration of TBM platform with all service management source systems and all service provider data/systems. This role will partner across IT systems owners and service providers to achieve these deliverables. This is a great leadership opportunity to be involved at an early stage ground level in a critical transformative program.




Accountabilities




• Define IT towers, sub-towers and cost pools data model within a TBM standard taxonomy to achieve TBM cost transparency, insights and benchmarking objectives for global IT spend.


• Understand and define data requirements from operational/service management source systems and from service providers for TBM platform including current state and future state data requirements.


• Focusing on good / better / best concepts of data and drive towards achieving superior data quality and completeness for operational & service management data related to TBM;


• Establish integration patterns to be utilized for integration between source systems and TBM solution

What you will do


Generate reports and analyses that help drive and track measurable pricing improvements
Develop and maintain margin bridge analyses using transaction data to explain the price-volume-cost-mix drivers of P&L gross margin across Domains, Lines of Businesses and Areas
Provide insights that can be used to identify price optimization opportunities and drive future pricing decisions
Provide analytics based on historical transactions to the Finance and Pricing teams across Areas and Domains


How you will do it


Collect and aggregate data from multiple sources to build the foundational analysis needed to understand the impact of current prices and discounting behaviors
Create tools used to measure pricing performance and price realization, and provide reports to pricing and sales teams across areas and lines of business
Develop financial “what – if” modeling approaches, working with key organizational contacts, to evaluate the business and improve pricing effectiveness
Work cross-functionally with Pricing, Finance and other functional areas to provide analytics and reporting in support of pricing realization, domain growth and profitability objectives
Understand customer decision-making criteria, product value, market conditions, and competitive dynamics to maximize share growth and margin expansion

What we look for


Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Finance, or a related field
An inquisitive personality, with an innate drive to seek out root cause and the creativity to provide unique solutions
A strong attention to detail with the desire to work autonomously and manage multiple projects
Strong financial analysis skills and experience with financial reporting
Demonstrated track record of working cross-functionally with multiple teams; ability to collaborate with and influence others in a matrixed environment
Excellent SQL programming and Microsoft Excel skills (e.g. ability to utilize pivot tables, vlookup, aggregate functions)
Working knowledge of Power BI or other business intelligence tools, data mining and data handling software (e.g., Alteryx, Micorsoft Access, Thinkcell). Ability to learn and utilize similar tools and pricing softwares
3+ years of experience in pricing analysis or related field preferred (Finance, Accounting experience is a plus)
Ability to travel up to 5% of the time

Identifies inconsistencies in data or results, defines business issues and formulates recommendations on policies, procedures or practices. Good understanding of how the team interacts with others in accomplishing the objectives of the area. Develops working knowledge of industry practices and standards. Responsibilities:
Incumbents work with large and complex data sets (both internal and external data) to evaluate, recommend, and support the implementation of business strategies

0-2 years relevant experience

¿Estás buscando aplicar tus conocimientos como Data Scientist?
¿Quisieras trabajar en una empresa que cuente con la tecnología adecuada, grandes volúmenes de datos de diversas fuentes y aplicar técnicas estadísticas avanzadas para proponer oportunidades de negocio?
En Citibanamex puedes desarrollar, implementar y ajustar soluciones analíticas que sean automáticas, replicables y escalables en distintos lenguajes de programación. Y si disfrutas de un ambiente laboral que promueva el aprendizaje e innovación continua. ¡Tenemos la mejor opción para ti!
Descripción:
DecisionScience es un área en dónde analizamos grandes volúmenes de datos de diversas fuentes, con técnicas de análisis innovadoras, combinadas con nuevas plataformas tecnológicas y modelos de última generación, dando soluciones o áreas de oportunidad al negocio.
Diseñamos e implementamos nuevas estrategias con el fin de dar un mejor servicio a nuestros clientes, desarrollamos estrategias para productos de crédito al consumo y captación, proponemos y comprendemos KPI’s para presentar resultados sintetizados a alta dirección.
Responsabilidades:
Trabajar en conjunto con otras áreas del Banco (Producto, Segmento, Riesgo, Finanzas, Cross Sell, etc.) para diseñar e implementar nuevas estrategias.
Identificar oportunidades de alto impacto, proponer estrategias que se traducirán en crecimiento de cartera e ingresos a través de modelos estadísticos y minería de datos.
Desarrollar análisis de datos de varias fuentes (demográficos, financieras, de buró de crédito, transaccionales, redes sociales, etc.).
Investigación para proponer soluciones de vanguardia.
Diseño del monitoreo de los modelos implementados y dar mantenimiento a los mismos.
Requisitos:
Licenciado en Actuaría, Matemáticas, Ingeniería, Economía o afines (carrera por terminar o últimos semestres).
Nivel de inglés: Intermedio-avanzado
Habilidades:
Capacidad para traducir números en estrategias accionables.
Auto organizado, colaborativo, proactivo, creativo con habilidades de negociación, liderazgo y comunicación.
Resiliencia y adaptación al cambio.
Habilidades e interés en programación y análisis estadístico (experiencia con SAS, SQL, R y / o Python - deseable).
Experiencia en minería de datos, modelos estadísticos, series de tiempo, econometría, etc. (deseable)

The principal purpose of this job is to develop product data for North America Power products, enabling our digital platforms including BIM and the LayoutFAST suite of tools, web, and eCommerce. The data will be consumed by customers including specifiers, contractors, OEMs, panelbuilders, end users, and distributors in different phases from awareness to design to quote and to Order Processing. Product data ultimately will produce customer quote bills of material, price, cost, category numbers, delivery codes, and drawings.
To develop a Product Data Model, one must have product knowledge in low voltage power products, expert understanding of manufacturing processes and systems, expert knowledge of quote, order, change order, price determination and PDP (Product Development Process). The ideal candidate combines application/order engineering, product management and regional marketing skills.

Key Job Responsibilities
1. Manage product data projects for a product line(s) across the USA, Canada, & Mexico. Each project may utilize 3-5 resources (engineering, marketing, offer management). This role must track progress, preparing weekly status reports, distribute and resolve issues/conflicts that arise from corrective action reports.
2. Develop product feature-based question and answer sets (e.g. Ampacity, Voltage, Enclosure Type, etc.) utilizing the BIM platform DATAmanager.
3. Specify and perform data entry of rule logic that validates the answers provided by the customer by preventing mutually exclusive answer conditions as well as making sure required options have been selected under specific conditions.
4. Develop and maintain configuration logic
5. Specify the layout validation logic for products that allow custom arranged component placement (similar to a Device Placement specification). This is applicable on a product by product basis.
6. Specify and perform data entry of product pricing and pricing rule logic. Same applies to delivery codes, cost, category and feature description tables (may require English and/or French and/or Spanish currency and language).
7. Specify and perform data entry in a modified version of FAST to BIM documents and the application logic that delivers automated drawings to the quotation and order processing environments.
8. Develop test environments for product selector projects, participate in testing process where appropriate. Testing may encompass all aspects of product data.
9. Support evolving data needs for Web and ecommerce.

The successful candidate will work closely with our Application Marketing Offer Managers for various Low Voltage and Medium Voltage data tasks. This work could consist of MS Excel data formatting and review, working within Schneider Electric tools, or other. The primary goal will be to have this role help offset any type of data requests from the Offer/Product Managers so that they can focus on Strategy, Inovation, and Support of their offers.
Qualifications

Qualifications
Minimum years of experience needed for position: 2
Product knowledge in low voltage and medium voltage power products is a plus
Understanding of manufacturing processes and systems
The ideal candidate combines application/order engineering, product management, project management, data analyst, and regional marketing skills.

Manages a broad range of moderately complex supply chain processes, such as inventory analysis and planning, demand management, logistics management, and import/export operations typically with a large or complex global business unit.
Identifies opportunities for process improvement and develops recommendations.
Independently executes the demand and supply matching activities, connecting planning to execution, and identifying issues and their impact.

Very Strong communication and influencing skills; mastery in English and local language.
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office skills (Excel, PowerPoint, etc.) including Power BI™ is a must
SAP S/4Hana ERP
Strong business acumen and technical knowledge within area of responsibility.
Thorough knowledge of inventory analysis.

About the Job

At TrailStone we believe in shared success for our investors and our employees. Success is driven by exceptional people working together as a team with a passion for the mission and common values.

TrailStone is a global energy trader and risk manager. Our mission is to play a leading role in facilitating the worldwide transition to renewable power. Our primary business is real-time management of electricity generation assets. Our team of traders, meteorologists, software engineers, risk managers, and data scientists aim to increase the stability of electric grids while minimizing risk for generators of intermittent electricity from wind and solar investments. TrailStone leverages its energy market experience and predictive modelling platform to take and manage financial trading risk in energy markets.

As a Contract Python Developer you will be working on developing best in class microservices for our renewables trading platform. Currently we are in a strong growth phase and are working on building a world class product to help us scale and bring renewables to many more power markets in the world, while trading many more smaller electricity assets. If you are interested in contributing to the success of this platform keep on reading!

Tasks

Design, develop and maintain microservices, ETL jobs and system components for our serverless Python-based data integration, processing and analytics platform
Work in a cross-functional team with engineers, business analysts, traders and data scientists
Stay up to date with the latest trends in technology and continuously improve our platform
Mentor junior members in the team by relentlessly guarding code quality through pull requests and code reviews

Skills

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or another technical field and/or provable relevant industry experience
Strong communication skills and a very high level of written and verbal English language
Solid understanding of object-oriented, functional and asynchronous programming and design patterns in a modern programming language (preferable Python)
A passion for delivering clean code and working with a test-driven mindset
Ideally knowledgeable about parts of the following tech stack: Flask, Pandas, Airflow, PySpark, Fargate, Docker, S3, Aurora, TimescaleDB, InfluxDB, RabbitMQ
Advanced knowledge of SQL
DevOps mindset with appreciation to work in a cloud-native and container-driven architecture (partly on-premise and partly AWS)
Ideally domain knowledge in the energy sector

Traits

Proactive, pragmatic problem solver with a strong bias for action
Actively help yourself and others to be successful
A positive, team-oriented mindset, and a passion for mentoring and sharing knowledge
Self-starter, requiring little supervision or guidance
Shows ownership and accountability in all aspects of work
Comfortable in a startup environment with less structure and driven by deadlines
Continuously learn and challenge the status quo

You will use your related experience to contribute to the firm's M&A execution and capital raising capabilities while helping build J.P. Morgan's franchise and reputation in the marketplace.
The successful candidate will play a central role in all aspects of executing live advisory transactions across all industry sectors and developing strategic dialog with clients. The Analyst's responsibilities will include but not be limited to the following:
Build and maintain complex financial models to perform analyses under different scenarios
Perform full valuation analyses, including DCF, trading comparables, precedent transactions, LBO analyses, among others
Prepare and review complex financial analyses, including transaction impact analyses such as earnings accretion/dilution and value creation
Participate in day-to-day deal execution, interacting with senior deal team members, senior client executives, transaction counterparties and other advisors
Manage due diligence processes, including preparing virtual data rooms, tracking and coordinating the information flow, and reviewing and analyzing company information
Prepare pitches, descriptive memorandums, management presentations, Board presentations and other materials
Design and analyze transactions' rationale, structures, financial impacts, etc. Monitor and evaluate current events related to clients, industries or transactions

Bachelors' Degree from and fluency in English - experience in M&A is highly preferred
Solid analytical skills, able to quickly and intuitively analyze and correctly interprets data
Strong knowledge of corporate finance and accounting, as well as basic understanding of legal and tax aspects related to M&A transactions
Solid financial modeling/valuation, including DCF, LBO, trading comparables, precedent transactions, accretion/dilution, value creation analysis, three-statement models and combined pro forma models
Intellectual curiosity, desire to learn, detail oriented, proactive and highly organized
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, handling multiple projects with different teams and under time constraints
Ability to comfortably interact with clients in a professional and mature manner
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills with specific ability to communicate concepts and ideas concisely and defend their validity
Outstanding ethics, integrity and judgment
Excellent technology skills with superior Excel and PowerPoint skills and ability to quickly learn new software applications

J.P. Morgan's Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader across banking, markets and investor services. The world's most important corporations, governments and institutions entrust us with their business in more than 100 countries. With $24 trillion of assets under custody and $420 billion in deposits, the Corporate & Investment Bank provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk and extends liquidity in markets around the world.JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. The Prod Ctrl Analyst 2 is an intermediate level position responsible for ensuring the completeness, accuracy and integrity of the bank's books and records in coordination with the Finance team. Monitor, assess, analyze, and evaluate processes and data

Escalate anomalies and issues in an efficient and timely manner
Interpret data, identify inconsistencies through research and recommend solutions based on analysis
Develop knowledge of how team interacts with others to accomplish Finance goals

Exchange complex information succinctly and with discretion
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

0-2 years of relevant experience
Consistently demonstrates clear and concise written and verbal communication

Daily financial close out of transactions including Income Statement analysis, journal entry posting responsibility and validation of ledger balances.

Participate on business specific projects and research
Assist in balance sheet reviews and reporting for monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting

Developing and providing analytics / metrics for the management team

Main Purpose




We are PepsiCo. We are a diverse organization, spread among 200 countries and united by a shared set of values and goals. That’s why we Perform with Purpose. Together, we blaze new trails, succeed, celebrate and never settle for second best. Requisition Summary
As Automation Operations Analyst you will have responsibility for the identification, implementation and growth of process automations across Infrastructure and Operations. In addition, you will manage/support the entire project life cycle of converting manual IT processes to an automated state.
Job Functions / Responsibilities
Manage process discovery for planned processes to be automated. This will involve capturing current state of process to analyze process standards and metrics in order to provide solutions for improvements and automation.
Develop process improvement procedures to drive operational efficiency using automation / orchestration tools such as Ansible / Chef / Puppet.
Perform data gathering, root cause analysis and performance trending in order to develop appropriate process changes.
Create, manage, update and maintain documentation on process improvements and automation.
Work with Subject Matter Experts to develop process improvement metrics for setting forth progress, trends and appropriate recommendations and conclusions.
Assist with the implementation of process change based on the organizational metrics as defined by leadership.
Manage a project plan to implement process changes and automation across I&O.
Contribute to ensuring on-going automation operations are running per design and assisting with production support where needed.
Help establish governance and control processes around I&O automation.
Qualifications
Must have the ability to interact effectively with functional peer groups to gain commitment and cooperation from others, including 3rd party vendors.
Strong communications and presentation skills, along with the ability to lead meetings.
Business process improvement implementation skills: requirements/process analysis, conceptual and detailed design, configuration, testing, training, change management, and support.
Ability to influence business leaders and peers about the proper use of standard business process flows and system functionality.
Demonstrated initiative and ability to work independently with minimal supervision. Must be a good team player.
Must be responsive and deadline-oriented with a sense of urgency.
Must be familiar with DevOps processes.
Automation Operation Analyst experience is essential.
Experience with orchestration technologies like Ansible or similar is highly desirable.
Advanced knowledge of MS Office applications and other productivity tools.
Experience working with structured and unstructured data, including relational databases (E.g. SQL Server), flat files (CSV), NoSQL databases (E.g. MongoDB) and data replication (E.g. Qlik Replicate - Formerly Attunity)
Ability to create process flow diagrams.
Advanced analytical and problem definition and solving abilities.
Experience of organizing and presenting data through visualization tools (E.g. Tableau).
Education
Undergraduate Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related field preferred.

titulo: Data Analytics Manager Mexico, D.F. Mexico, Mexico Commercia...
descripcion:
Be a part of a groundbreaking change

At PMI, we’ve chosen to do something incredible. We’re totally transforming our business, and building our future on smoke-free products with the power to improve the lives of a billion smokers worldwide.



With huge change, comes huge opportunity. So, wherever you join us, you’ll enjoy the freedom to dream up and deliver better, brighter solutions and the space to move your career forward in endlessly different directions.


We are looking for a Data Analytics Manager to join our team in Mexico who will contribute to the Data Analyst Leaders team PBO development plan through proper feedback and guidance from all members that provide support.



Your ‘day to day’

Facilitate a data driven decision making of the business units (Marketing, Digital & Sales), through a solid understanding of the business needs and opportunities by translating data into business sense and gathering & connecting business knowledge not available in data, while supporting all commercial needs (ie. brand performance, consumer preferences and profiling, etc.) providing insights and information for fast and accurate strategic and operational decision making.



Role responsibilities:

Provide the business units information and insights to take strategic decisions, by a solid understanding of business questions or reformulating those questions, obtaining not available data from the business knowledge and exploiting existing data, developing statistical, mathematical, data science and business analysis, applying existing algorithms or generating new ones to ensure objective answers, while identifying insights and correlations not requested by the business and communicate those to the business units.Ensure that business units has quick and accurate access to information needed to operate the business, facilitating processes' input of information while promptly advising when some indicator goes out of standard range to take action by the business units.Connect all different data available to ensure a complete comprehension of the business to take concrete strategic decisions, by objectively communicating it to all stake holders, avoiding “data silos” and elimination of analysis duplicity while providing consistency in results interpretations to the whole organization.Canalize data product needs to the data science team while supporting in the conceptual design of them, ensuring full understanding of the business needs and the visualization to be used by the different areas teams.


Education & Experience

Bachelor’s Degree preferably in an exact science or mathematical related (Data Science, mathematics, statistics, computing, etc).Overall experience: Minimum of 5 years in Data Science or business intelligence with commercial involvement. Consultants for other companies, involve in analytics, data science and big data management.Programming in R, Python, Weka, NumPy, MatLab, Visual Basic, Power BI.People skills, managing others and interacting with business (Business Language)Proficient English (written and spoken).


What we offer


Our success depends on the men and women who come to work every single day with a sense of purpose and an appetite for progress. Join PMI and you too can:

Be part of an inclusive, diverse culture, where everyone’s contribution is respected; collaborate with some of the world’s best people and feel like you belong.Pursue your ambitions and develop your skills with a global business – our staggering size and scale provides endless opportunities to progress.Take pride in delivering our promise to society: to improve the lives of a billion smokers.

Introduction

Do you want to help us transform the way IBM manages Incentives for all its Sellers?




As an Agile delivery organization, our mission is to deliver best-in-class systems and tools that differentiate us from our competitors and help our Sales incentives partners and Sellers with tools to drive sustained revenue growth by enabling the Sales plan & Go-to-market strategy.



Our team incorporates Design Thinking and cutting edge technologies and practices to design and build signature experiences that make IBM Sales Force’s lives easier.




Our systems are built on logical modular blocks integrated into a single architecture and tool suite and we deliver:



.+1 Billion Transactions processed every year from .+100 sources, transformed into payroll and sent to sellers individually.


.100 Thousand Sales Plans successfully implemented twice a year

. 170 Terabytes of data.


. 40 modules developed and supported.



Your Role and Responsibilities

We are looking for someone who...



Is a high-calibre Full Stack Developer to join our team, building applications and solving problems for IBM's Incentives

We have an exciting collaborative space which brings together best-in-class people, technology and workspaces to create leading software solutions. We take a group of designers, developers, and business analysts, so that they work together to address the problem, in a "We give you a problem, you decide how to solve it" environment.

You’ll be using the latest tools and technologies available to deliver state-of-the-art software and web applications. You’ll have the opportunity to work with the latest technologies, ensuring the applications delivered are high performing, responsive and maintainable.



You’ll be responsible for ensuring that components are expertly designed, tested, debugged, verified, and ready for integration into various contexts across the IBM Enterprise, creating a productive environment for IBMers. You will be responsible of different features and for leading technical discussions, ensuring a plan of execution is in place to deliver requirements.







Required Technical and Professional Expertise


Proven experience in an Object Oriented Programming Language: more than 4 years
Proven experience working with JavaScript, HTML and CSS
Experience delivering web applications using JavaScript frameworks such as AngularJS/Angular, React, Vue.js
Experience with Unit Testing Frameworks
Familiarity with experience with Test Driven and Behaviour Driven Development practices (TDD & BDD)
Experience working in close collaboration with designers, business analysts and product owners
Experience building according to design specifications with pixel perfect accuracy
Architecting and developing APIs
Proficient understanding of Git, or other source code management systems
Familiarity with CI/CD practices and tools
Designing SQL complex statements
Demonstrable experience working in Agile development frameworks
English – Advanced


Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise



Experience mentoring and coaching junior team membersFamiliarity with Linux Shell ScriptingFamiliarity with Docker or similar container-based solutionsUnderstanding of best practices for continuous integration & delivery







About Business Unit

The IBM Finance organization is responsible for driving enterprise performance and transformation. We are the financial stewards of IBM, delivering IBM’s financial strategy, developing new business models, and mitigating enterprise risk. Do you have a passion for creating business value? Join our team in accounting, financial planning, pricing, business controls, tax, treasury, business development (acquisitions & divestitures), and global financing.



Your Life @ IBM

What matters to you when you’re looking for your next career challenge?



Maybe you want to get involved in work that really changes the world? What about somewhere with incredible and diverse career and development opportunities – where you can truly discover your passion? Are you looking for a culture of openness, collaboration and trust – where everyone has a voice? What about all of these? If so, then IBM could be your next career challenge. Join us, not to do something better, but to attempt things you never thought possible.



Impact. Inclusion. Infinite Experiences. Do your best work ever.



About IBM

IBM’s greatest invention is the IBMer. We believe that progress is made through progressive thinking, progressive leadership, progressive policy and progressive action. IBMers believe that the application of intelligence, reason and science can improve business, society and the human condition. Restlessly reinventing since 1911, we are the largest technology and consulting employer in the world, with more than 380,000 IBMers serving clients in 170 countries.



Location Statement

For additional information about location requirements, please discuss with the recruiter following submission of your application.



Being You @ IBM

IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

There are 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we’re all about at John Deere. And it’s why we’re investing in our people and our technology like never before in our 175-year history. Here the world’s brightest minds are tackling the world’s biggest challenges. If you believe one person can make the world a better place, we’ll put you to work. RIGHT NOW.
Title: PDM Administrator

Primary Location: Mexico (MX) - Coahuila

Function: Product Engineering
Major Purpose
Provides a high level of technical expertise in a leadership role in Part Data Management (PDM) and Specifications and assures that PDM requirements are properly applied and maintained within the Unit. Conducts Functional Geometry Reviews and assists engineering in dimensioning and tolerancing their geometry/drawings. Maintains the documentation for the design release procedure and conducts technical training and development of unit personnel as required. May work with unit personnel and suppliers developing guidelines for the design, manufacture and inspection of parts and assemblies.
Major Duties
Conducts functional geometry reviews on parts and assemblies to ensure quality goals and functional requirements of models/drawings and specifications are met.
Provides team leadership in coordinating and performing Parts Data Management (PDM) and specification work throughout the unit to include training, resolving issues, diagnosing problems and recommending corrective actions.
Updates and maintains appropriate web pages to provide consistent geometry/drawing information for the user community. Provides training in Geometric Dimensioning & Tolerancing as required.
Evaluates and recommends methods to improve service support from suppliers related to improving service parts and parts catalog delivery, engineering communications, field support, managing engineering record reciprocity and accuracy of supplier specification documents.
Provides coaching to other units in such matters as design control, procurement of service parts, engineering communication methods and systems dealing with suppliers.
Participates in the development and implementation of improved Part Data Management (PDM) and specification processes to include evaluating service parts proliferation, expedition of parts for new product introductions and discontinued products.
Coordinates the activities of Specification Analyst/Writers to include training, diagnosing issues and resolving problems.
Provides language translation and interpretation services as required.
Skills, Abilities, Knowledge
Skill in using computer aided design and/or engineering tools.
Skill in using company information systems and processes.
Knowledge in engineering principles, theory and practice as well as product knowledge.
Understanding of specification systems and decision release systems.
Knowledge of industry standards for dimension and tolerancing, weld symbols, etc.
Knowledge of Product Delivery Process programs.
This position will be posted for a minimum of 7 business days and unposted when a qualified pool of candidates is achieved.
Candidates must have the necessary work permits to work in the country.

As Business Insights Analyst you will be responsible for delivery of key client analytics and consulting projects. You will develop analytical insights that measure our clients’ performance across key inputs (such as content quality, compliance, performance metrics, customer experience, etc.). On the basis of this data, you will articulate key insights and best practices, provide a recommendation on the overall campaign strategy, set ambitious revenue and/or performance objectives and assist internal partners on how to define detailed action plans to reach these goals.
Key Responsibilities:
Additionally, you will lead the thinking and lead the development of monitoring tools/dashboard (Google, Power BI, Tableau, etc) to report on key results achieved by business and draw out insights on further optimization opportunities. As part of this role, you will also be breaking down and communicating the reports and opportunities to key operational partners. You will also be involved in the maintenance of the back-end and front-end architecture of the BIDS reporting for the specific campaign(s) you support, the proprietary analytical tool that aggregates, mines and elaborates campaign reporting. As a business insights analyst, you will be partnering closely with Reporting Analysts, Data Visualization Analysts, Data Scientists, and Data Engineers to optimize the assigned business(s) you support. In addition, this role requires close attention and engagement with business owners, cross functional teams, and at times clients.

At least two years of experience working in Consulting, Business Intelligence, Strategy/Insights, or similar teams
Bachelor’s degree, concentration in business, Business Intelligence, Data Analytics, Statistics or equivalent of experience in similar workspace
Passionate about technology start-ups and driving innovation with data!
Strong problem-solving skills and analytical mindset with a test-measure-iterate approach
Excellent communication skills
Ability to manage and prioritize well across competing requirements
High IT Literacy proven use of web and associated technologies (Excel, Power Point, Google apps)
Previous experience with Data Visualization tools (Tableau, Power Bi, ect.) is strongly preferred
Ability to interact with directly and influence operational partners, cross functional teams, senior clients
Other duties as assigned

titulo: Head of Customer Management Credit Analytics
descripcion:
Head of Customer Management Credit Analytics


We are looking for a Credit Manager / Senior Analyst to Head all credit analytics for the customer management stage (post acquisition) and create various policies for existing customers so as to provide them with additional products and services that will drive business growth. The person will help develop analysis and reporting capabilities as well as monitor strategy / policy / process performance to identify and recommend improvements.


Responsibilities

End to end ownership of credit strategy for existing customers
Work with the Data Science team to create new underwriting models that will help assess creditworthiness of existing customers
Be able to use enormous amounts of data to do different types of economic and financial analyses on our customers (assess credit worthiness)
Understand unit economics (profitability) of existing product and services as well as recommended products and services
Build credit frameworks and policies to offer new products and services to existing customers and drive growth of loan portfolio
Be able to generate NPV models for existing customers that will feed into the credit strategy framework and policies
Create a testing agenda to collect data to inform future strategy
Work with ops, product and tech to execute new credit policies



Requirements

Experience as a credit manager in lending while managing high performing credit analysts
Sound credit / business judgement and experience in creating credit policies
Experience in working with data scientists in creating underwriting models
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc).
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages (Business Objects etc) and databases (SQL etc)
Understanding of potential legal, compliance and market risk related issues
Strong communication and presentation skills
Ability to work with multiple teams across functions
BS degree in Actuarial Science, Economics, Finance, Business, Statistics or related field
Masters (preferred)

Key responsibilities include improving the supply chain responsibly data analysis, management, reporting and data tools/capabilities improvement. Areas of work includes, but not limited to:
Labor Key Performance Indicator (KPI) program coordination
Digitizing the KPI reports, receiving and managing supplier KPI data, supporting the program manager in preparation of the monthly and quarterly executive reports and providing end of year data summary and assurance for the company annual sustainability report
SCR Scorecard Dashboard management
Automating the processes for the SCR scorecard and database, generating the scorecard with the appropriate supplier data, analyzing and interpreting the required data view and develop graphs etc. to facilitate supplier performance reviews conducted by the business unit liaison managers and HP operations business partners
Corrective Action Plan (CAP) progress follow up
Manage corrective action plan communication between the supplier and HP, keep track of the CAP submissions and track data on non-conformances, prepare and present slides in regular audit/assessments meetings
Supplier Self-Assessment Questionnaire (SAQ) data management
Prepare SAQ to be sent to HP facilities, provide information on the SAQ files, issue SAQ related communication, keep track of the SAQ completion and receive and report SAQ data
Other:
Supporting other Sustainability and Product Compliance team-level projects and reports (ranking and ratings, Sustainable Impact Report), including tools enhancement and process development across the organization.

Our Commitment to Our People

Flexible and competitive benefits plans offer you the right options to meet your individual/family needs: medical insurance plans, dental and vision coverage, 401(k), tuition reimbursement, and more. We provide employees flexible time off plans including paid parental leave (maternal and paternal), vacation and holiday leave.


Our success is measured by the positive impact we make on people, our communities and the world in which we live. Learn more about us!.


Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion
At Emerson, we are committed to fostering a culture where every employee is valued and respected for their experiences and perspectives. We believe a diverse and inclusive work environment contributes to the rich exchange of ideas that inspires innovation and brings the best solutions to our customers. This philosophy is fundamental to living our company’s values and our responsibility to leave the world in a better place.


Diversity and Inclusion at Emerson is about welcoming, respecting, and valuing the differences each employee possesses. Inclusion is creating a real sense of engagement, belonging and connection for all employees. Learn more about ourCulture & Values and about Diversity & Inclusion at Emerson.


Work Authorization
Emerson will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1, H-1, H-2, L, B, J, or TN or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire.

ABOUT EMERSON
Emerson, a Fortune 500 company with $18.4 billion in sales, more than 20 Innovation, Solutions & Engineering Centers, and 200 manufacturing locations worldwide, is committed to helping employees grow and thrive throughout their careers. We are innovators, question-askers and problem-solvers. We don’t settle for good enough or “This is the way it’s always been done.” Instead, we push ourselves and strive for the “never been done before.”

Our Automation Solutions business enables the greatest use of the world's most valuable resources, ensuring the performance and safety of industries that are the backbone of daily life.

Our Commercial & Residential Solutions business helps ensure human comfort and health, protect food quality and safety, advance energy efficiency and create sustainable infrastructure.

No calls or agencies please.

The IC3 Calling team is on a mission to deliver world leading VoIP and Public Switch Telephone Network (PSTN) capabilities across Microsoft Teams, Skype, and Skype For Business products. To accomplish this, the Global Carrier Services team requires a customer-focused individual to work directly with customers, an existing service desk, Microsoft engineering teams, and external telco carriers, to enable customers to successfully and smoothly transition to Microsoft Office Conferencing and Calling products.


The Service Desk is a critical component of the Global Carrier Services team working closely with enterprise customers. The team is responsible for assisting customers porting their telephone numbers to Microsoft or helping them acquire global telephone numbers.


We are looking for a subject matter expert in telephone number management, the candidate must be experienced in service desk operations and have experience or a strong desire to deeply understand telephone numbers, including but not limited to their structure, how they are sourced, national numbering plans, and how to manage an inventory of global telephone numbers.


Come join our team and help global customers onboard to world leading products, like Microsoft Teams.


This role requires rotating shifts, with potential weekend and public holidays work and a willingness to develop best-in-class practices and processes to make customer onboarding a world class experience.
Responsibilities
Key responsibilities are:
Become a subject matter expert of global telephone numbers acquisition and porting processes.
Handles sensitive data while adhering to strict security and privacy rules.
Provide up to date and actionable briefings to the leadership chain regarding current business operations, customer incidents, customer orders, and tolling/process issues.
Actively participate in service desk daily work
Proactively identifies process gaps /issues, and present solutions for resolution.
Raise team awareness of process changes.
When needed, Provide team training of process changes.
Take ownership of a playbook of processes, keeping them current and useful.
Propose and implement preventative measures, process enhancements and improved tolling functionality.
Work with analysts, subject matter experts, and program managers to enhance the customer experience through change.
Adhere to, closely monitor, and report on KPIs including time to action, and exhausted telephone number supply.
Qualifications
Language Support Requirements:
English – Full Professional Proficiency - Written and Spoken - Required
Spanish – Full Professional Proficiency - Written and Spoken – Strongly Preferred
German – Full Professional Proficiency – Written and Spoken – Desired, not required
Behavior and characteristics:
Customer empathy finds solutions to meet customers’ needs whilst maintaining Microsoft’s obligations.
Strong leadership and a nurturing personality
Willingness to go the extra mile it takes to succeed, or help our customers succeed.
Comfortable working cross group including with program managers, analysts, engineering, data scientists, 3rd party companies across the company, industry, and the world.
Comfortable coordinating and running meetings with senior team members.
Ability to implement other’s ideas and requests as well as generate your own.
Self-motivated, tenacious, strong team player
Ability to catalogue, structure, and priorities numerous reports and requests.
Ability to plan and execute projects on behalf of a team with a wide range of tasks.
Desire to learn and improve constantly.
Desire to contribute to a world class team on a world class service for a world class company.
Comfortable and confident talking with Microsoft’s largest customers.
Ability to make decisions with speed and confidence.
Ability to lead discussions with customers and understand their needs.
Ability to influence customers to optimize for successfully migrations to the cloud.
Ability to learn and work quickly in an ambiguous and changing environment, with a strong attitude.
Highly self-driven with an ability to work independently.
Highly organized with great project management skills
Ability to communicate effectively with enterprise customers and defuse customer escalations.
Meticulous with an analytical mindset, enjoys analyzing and interpreting data.
Must be resilient to stress and versatile enough to transition between competing tasks and priorities with high frequency.
Must be balanced between speed and quality.
Desired experience and technical skills
Bachelor’s degree preferably in International Business, Intelligence Studies, Management Information Systems, Computer Science. Other relevant experience considered in lieu of specific degree.
2+ years of experience working in a service desk or other relevant experience.
1+ years of experience working with high value IT enterprise/corporate customers
1+ years of experience in a project or program management role
2+ years of experience working in a high-pressure environment
2+ years of experience working in a business operations role
1+ years of experience in the telecommunications, fixed line or VOIP preferred
1+ years of experience managing a service desk team in the high-tech industry preferred
2+ years incident and customer relationship management experience
Strong capabilities in Microsoft Office products
Telephone system, phone number management, phone number porting experience are a plus
Data analysis experience and strong Microsoft Excel or other data analysis tool knowledge
Proven experience using PowerShell, SQL or other development languages
ITIL/Six Sigma Certification is a plus


Location: City of Mexico, Mexico
